SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.events.Observable
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Game
public class Game extends Observable
The Game class represents a game session of the Codex Naturalis game

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(DeckLoader<PlayCard> goldCardDeckLoader, DeckLoader<PlayCard> resourceCardDeckLoader, DeckLoader<StartCard> startCardDeckLoader, DeckLoader<Goal> goalDeckLoader, String idGame, int expectedPlayers) throws IOException
      Constructs a new Game object, initializing the game components. In particular, the Decks' content is loaded from the provided files.
      Parameters:
      goldCardDeckLoader - DeckLoader that loads the game's Gold Cards
      resourceCardDeckLoader - DeckLoader that loads the game's Resource Cards
      startCardDeckLoader - DeckLoader that loads the game's Start Cards
      goalDeckLoader - DeckLoader that loads the game's Goals
      idGame - the identifier of the game that players can use to rejoin a specific game
      Throws:
      IOException - if there's a problem reading one of the files

    • Game

      public Game(GameData gsm)
      Constructs a new Game object from existing data
      Parameters:
      gsm - game data

  • Method Details

    • getSaving

      public GameData getSaving()
      Retrieves the Game's data in a format that can be loaded by another Game object.
      Returns:
      GameData object containing the Game's data

    • getClientSaving

      public ClientGameData getClientSaving(String clientNickname)
      Retrieves the Game's data in a format that can be loaded by another Game in the Client's model. Requires a nickname in order to only put "secret" information if the data is going to be sent to a player that is authorized to receive such information.
      Parameters:
      clientNickname - the nickname of the client that will receive the requested data
      Returns:
      ClientGameData object containing the Game's data that the receiving player is authorized to receive.

    • updateAvailableColors

      public void updateAvailableColors()
      Update the availableColors set according to the updated players list

    • getBackupKey

      public String getBackupKey()
      Compute the unique backup key for the set of players that are playing this game
      Returns:
      the game's backup key

    • resetPlayers

      public void resetPlayers()
      Empties the players list

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(Player player)
      Adds a player to the game. A player can only be added if the game is not started yet.
      Parameters:
      player - Player to add to the game.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the game's already started.

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(Player player)
      Removes one of the players from the players list. Won't work if the game has already been started.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player object that needs to be removed from the game.

    • getTurn

      public Player getTurn()
      Retrieves the player who needs to play now.
      Returns:
      Player whose turn it currently is.

    • nextTurn

      public void nextTurn()
      Advances the game to the next turn
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the game has not started yet.

    • setFinalRound

      public void setFinalRound()
      Sets the game to the final round
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the game has not started yet.

    • isFinalRound

      public boolean isFinalRound()
      Checks if the game is in the final round.
      Returns:
      true if the current round is final, false otherwise.

    • shufflePlayers

      public void shufflePlayers()
      Shuffles the players' turn order.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the game has already started

    • getChat

      public Chat getChat()
      Retrieves the game's Chat object.
      Returns:
      Game's Chat object.

    • setCommonGoals

      public void setCommonGoals(Goal[] goals)
      Allows to set the game's common goals. Won't work if the game has already been started.
      Parameters:
      goals - the array containing the common goals

    • getCommonGoals

      public Goal[] getCommonGoals()
      Retrieves the common goals for the current game.
      Returns:
      An array containing the common goals for the game.

    • setupScoreBoard

      public void setupScoreBoard()
      Create the ScoreBoard for the game with the players currently connected. This method shouldn't be used on the server, since it is intended for the client to create a "default" scoreboard before it receive an updated one from the server.

    • loadGame

      public void loadGame(GameData gameData)
      Reload a game from a GameData object
      Parameters:
      gameData - GameData that contains data regarding the game that needs to be loaded

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game by drawing and distributing cards. Once this method is called, it becomes impossible to edit the game's info.

    • getPlayers

      public List<Player> getPlayers()
      Retrieves the players that are playing the game (or that are waiting to play the game)
      Returns:
      a list of Player objects that represents the players in the game.

    • getExpectedPlayers

      public int getExpectedPlayers()
      Retrieves the number of players that the game is expecting.
      Returns:
      the number of players that the game is expecting.

    • getAvailableColor

      public Set<PlayerColor> getAvailableColor()
      Retrieves the available player colors for this game.
      Returns:
      a set of PlayerColor that represents the set of available colors.

    • getScoreBoard

      public ScoreBoard getScoreBoard()
      Retrieves the game scoreboard.
      Returns:
      a reference to the scoreboard that contains player's score for this game.

    • getResourceCardsDeck

      public Deck<PlayCard> getResourceCardsDeck()
      Retrieves the Resource cards deck.
      Returns:
      a reference to the resource cards deck.

    • getGoldCardsDeck

      public Deck<PlayCard> getGoldCardsDeck()
      Retrieves the Gold cards deck.
      Returns:
      a reference to the gold cards deck.

    • getVisibleCards

      public PlayCard[] getVisibleCards()
      Retrieves the visible cards.
      Returns:
      an array of PlayCard that represents the visible cards that can be picked up.

    • resetVisibleCards

      public void resetVisibleCards(int length)
      Empties the visible cards and recreate a new (empty) array with a specified length.

      Used on the client's View.

      Parameters:
      length - the length of the new visible cards array.

    • refillVisibleCards

      public void refillVisibleCards()
      Tries to fill the empty visible cards slots. First, it tries to fill each slots with its expected card type. It one of the decks runs out of cards, the visible cards slots that expect this kind of card can be filled with cards of the opposite type. If both decks are empty, the visible card slots will be left empty. (the game is bound to end shortly after in this case).

    • isFirstPlayersTurn

      public boolean isFirstPlayersTurn()
      Checks whether a new turn is starting.
      Returns:
      true if the player that is expected to player is the first player of the list, false otherwise.

    • getIdGame

      public String getIdGame()
      Retrieves the game's Identifier.
      Returns:
      the GameID for the current game.

    • emptyDecks

      public boolean emptyDecks()
      Checks whether both decks are empty.
      Returns:
      true if both decks are empty, false otherwise.

    • subscribeCommonObservers

      public void subscribeCommonObservers()
      Subscribes players to the decks and to the game itself.

    • subscribeCommonObservers

      public void subscribeCommonObservers(ClientHandler clientHandler)
      Subscribes a certain player to the common observers
      Parameters:
      clientHandler - the player that needs to be subscribed.

    • unsubscribeFromCommonObservable

      public void unsubscribeFromCommonObservable(ClientHandler clientHandler)
      Unsubscribes a certain player from the common observers
      Parameters:
      clientHandler - the player that needs to be unsubscribed.

    • getStartCardsDeck

      public Deck<StartCard> getStartCardsDeck()
      Retrieves the StartCard deck
      Returns:
      the StartCard Deck

    • getGoalsDeck

      public Deck<Goal> getGoalsDeck()
      Retrieves the Goal Deck
      Returns:
      the Goal Deck
